titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to present a gold medal on behalf of Congress to Rosa Parks.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Watts (OK) asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 6/8/1999--Introduced. Authorizes use of the rotunda of the Capitol on June 15, 1999, for a ceremony to present, on behalf of Congress, a congressional gold medal to Rosa Parks.
